name: Black-Eyed Peas (Black-Eyed Beans)
properties: Part of Daily Dozen - 3 servings of legumes daily
Cream-colored beans with distinctive black spot
Excellent source of plant-based protein and fiber
Rich in folate, iron, and potassium
Benefits excess body weight and insulin resistance
Quick-cooking legume with mild, earthy flavor
Versatile in salads, soups, and side dishes
benefits: Black-eyed peas are an excellent source of vitamins, minerals, fiber and antioxidants that support weight loss and metabolic health. They benefit excess body weight, insulin resistance, high cholesterol, inflammation, and oxidative stress. Their high fiber content promotes satiety and feeds beneficial gut bacteria, making them ideal for meeting the Daily Dozen's three daily servings of legumes and supporting heart disease prevention.
amount: Part of 3 daily servings of legumes (Daily Dozen). 1 serving = 1/2 cup cooked black-eyed peas
